intro: Festuca yvesii, commonly known as Yves' fescue, is a cool-season grass native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its fine, silver-blue foliage and dense, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. It is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements. Festuca yvesii is also valued for its ability to withstand drought and partial shade.
